description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Moments in Oia" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Moments in Oia

places.generalDescription: Skaros Rock is a centuries-old castle ruin perched on a rugged outcrop, offering breathtaking views of the Aegean Sea. This long-lost citadel in Santorini is a romantic and secluded spot to witness the mesmerizing sunset, steeped in the island's rich history and imposing atmosphere. Accessible via a steep track, it provides an ideal vantage point for admiring the glorious sunset.

sources.snippet: Also known as Skaros Fortress or Castle Skaros, this hotspot is a collection of rocks ü™® and ruins that serve incredible views of the surrounding Greek islands and ocean and is most definitely one of the best places to take photos in Santorini. It‚Äôs only a 30-minute hike to Skaros Rock from its starting point, and the journey is full of Instagram-worthy backdrops. üì± Especially at sunset when the sky is orange and the sun‚Äôs multicolored rays sink into the deep sea.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Take Photos in Santorini

sources.snippet: Skaros was originally one of five fortifed settlements on Santorini but since the early 1800‚Äôs it‚Äôs remained uninhabited after a series of eruptions. Now you‚Äôll find a church located on the northern (sea side) of the rock and a path that winds to the top where you can capture incredible photos at any time of the day. It‚Äôs a striking landscape in front of the quiet village of Imerovigli and well worth the hike up!
sources.siteName: Photo Tips, Creative Photography + Travel Guides - The Wandering Lens
sources.shortName: A Travel Guide to Santorini

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for an amazing viewpoint, Skaros Rock is the place to go. It offers one of the most breathtaking views of Santorini‚Äôs caldera and it‚Äôs definitely one of the best Santorini Instagram spots. However, it‚Äôs one of those Santorini photography spots you have to work for a little bit to get to.
sources.shortName: Top 29 Best Santorini Instagram Spots You Can't Miss

sources.snippet: And you can also walk all the way to the other side of the rock, or to the top!. We highly recommend doing this, because on the other side you‚Äôll find a surprise (spoiler: it‚Äôs another great Santorini photo spot!).
sources.shortName: Santorini Photography: 21+ Best Santorini Photo Spots + Map

places.name: Skaros Rock

reviews.text: Great little hike not for those who need assistance.  It is a hiking trail that is at the bottom of a very steep set of concrete steps.  I would estimate about 100 steps to get to the bottom so you can then transfer to a gravel trail.  I loved the hike and the exercise it was excellent and absolutely what I anticipated.. I will just say that it is NOT for the folks who would need assistance.

Lovely place to go for a short hike of roughly 60 minutes. The views from the rock are breathtaking and best to hike it in the morning (especially during hot summer months) when you get plenty of shaded area on the other side of the rock with lots of breeze thay feels quite refreshing.
There is a lovely church on the back side and lots of amazing view points.

A great hike that is definitely not for those in need to assistance. We walked from Santorini Princess so it was all in all good cardio. From actually starting the Skaros Rock trail to the second church in the other side of the point and back it took about 1 hour and another 1/2 hour for taking pictures, but my partner and I were setting a fast pace.
BRING/WEAR TENNIS SHOES IF YOU WANT TO MAKE IT ARUBD THE ROCK TO THE SECOND CHURCH COMFORTABLY. Lots of stairs and lots of places to go off trail, and even up the rock if you are adventurous. Very beautiful hike!

places.generalDescription: The Castle of Oia, also known as Saint Nicolas Castle, is a Renaissance-era fortress with a surviving watchtower that once guarded against pirates. It's renowned as the most sought-after sunset spot in Santorini, where visitors flock to capture the famous sunset view. While it's undeniably awe-inspiring, there are other serene and less crowded spots across the island to enjoy the beauty of the sunset.

sources.snippet: Every night at sunset crowds form at Oia Castle to watch the sun go down. It‚Äôs a bit of a zoo and not the romantic experience one would hope for. But if you wait a bit and go to the castle after you‚Äôve taken your photos at the domes, you can capture this magnificent view of the town of Oia lit up at blue hour showcasing the windmill.
sources.siteName: The Planet D: Adventure Travel Blog
sources.shortName: A Photography Guide to Santorini

sources.snippet: Oia Castle is the most popular spot for sunset photos in all of Santorini and, justifiably so, its sunsets were among best we‚Äôve ever seen. The best view of the the sunset is over Amoudi Bay against the backdrop of the gorgeous Oia buildings. The best angle we found was sitting on the wall of the Castle facing towards the bay.
sources.shortName: best photo spots in santorini

sources.snippet: A trip to Oia wouldn‚Äôt be complete without visiting the remains of the old castle. It‚Äôs the best spot to soak in the view of Santorini‚Äôs gorgeous Cycladic architecture ‚Äì an amazing patchwork of buildings. Phil being a pool-boy loved all the little swimming pools glowing bright blue next to all the white hues.
sources.shortName: 10 Santorini Instagram Spots - The Best Photo Locations

sources.snippet: The ruins of this medieval castle offer a sweeping 360-degree view of the sea. Also called Fort Londsa or Oia Castle, these Byzantine Ruins were the home of the Argyri family under Venetian rule. This is a landmark site and is a hotspot at sunset as the crowds arrive and the music starts to play.
sources.shortName: The Best Photo Locations on Santorini

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs actually very close to location 1 and directly right of the first location. Best time to go: morning right after sunrise (8am-10am). If you go too early, the sun might not be entirely out yet and you may have troubles with shadows (as seen in this photo)
sources.shortName: Top 10 Photo Spots in Santorini

sources.snippet: Those picture spots offer great views over Oia and Santorini, but will get extremely crowded daily for sunset as there is rather small place. ‚Ü¨ Read : 34 Pictures to Inspire You to Visit Milos Island
sources.shortName: Voyage in Style

sources.snippet: This is the #1 location to view those epic sunsets, but you‚Äôll be fighting for that view. I‚Äôd recommend coming here for photos throughout the day. You can even view the Santorini Windmill from here!
sources.shortName: 10 Santorini Instagram Spots You Can‚Äôt Miss

sources.snippet: This is probably THE reason any photographer comes to Santorini. The famous Santorini sunset photo spot is at Oia Castle.
sources.shortName: Santorini Photography: 21+ Best Santorini Photo Spots + Map

places.name: Castle of Oia

reviews.text:
It offers a tranquil, stunning and unforgettable view of sunsetting over Aegean Sea.

The surrounding areas also look stunning. There were music,playful cats and ,of course, a vibrant crowd as companions.

The catamarans and cruises make the view lively.

Love it.

Oia - one of the most popular attractions on Santorini. Perched on top of the cliffs, it offers stunning views. It gets crowded, so you might wait for the perfect photo. The vibe is amazing: people dress like it's a fashion show, making the whole place look stylish and beautiful.

One of the most beautiful places in the world!!! It offers an incredible view!! A true spectacle of nature ‚ù§Ô∏èü•∞ Shops and restaurants where you can enjoy good wine and spectacular views!!! You will fall in love with this beautiful island!!!

sources.snippet: This is not exactly a photo spot, but rather an experience that I can not recommend enough!. If you‚Äôre looking to get some amazing photos, I highly recommend doing a flying dress photoshoot. I did one with the company Flying Dress Photo and it was an amazing experience.
sources.shortName: Top 29 Best Santorini Instagram Spots You Can't Miss

reviews.text: I booked the flying dress photo shoot for my wife's birthday. Just wanted to say a huge thank you to the team. The photos taken were stunning, moreover the time taken to capture the best shots in all the great locations was much appreciated. I was just watching on for the most part, but it was a great experience. Really happy with the 5 star service. Thank you!

Wonderful experience!!!! 10 out of 10 these photos are just a preview. It shows how great the photographer (Vasilis) is. I highly recommend the company (Flying Dress Photo-Santorini). Communication was professional and my pickup and drop off was on time without any issues. The photographer and dress assistant did great with making sure I was comfortable and had a changing area for me to change. Thank you guys!!!

Some of my favorites from the Flying Dress Photo shoot in Santorini. A few people asked me if I brought the dress with me and the answer is NO! The dress rental is included and they have so many to choose from. The photographer and flying dress assistant we extremely professional and efficient. And yes I paid extra for a flying dress assistant who helps make the dress fly. So worth it!

places.generalDescription: The Blue Domed Church in Santorini is a must-visit spot and a favorite among travelers for its picturesque setting. The two iconic blue domes set against the white city center create a stunning sight that captures the essence of Santorini's architecture. Located in one of the most beautiful local villages, this spot offers amazing photo opportunities with views of the volcano. As the sun sets, these timeless symbols become even more enchanting against the colorful evening sky.

sources.snippet: Possibly the most famous Instagram spot and one of the top most instagrammable places in Santorini is the view of the blue dome church next to the pink church against the backdrop of the deep blue ocean. It is not just quintessentially Santorini, it is also incredibly stunning in person. It is no wonder that this is one of the most instagrammable places in Santorini as the architecture of the churches is just breathtaking.
sources.siteName: The Next Trip | Travel Tips and Destination Guides
sources.shortName: 15 Most Instagrammable Places in Santorini You Can't Miss | The Next Trip

sources.snippet: If you turn around from Aspaki Suites, you‚Äôll find the famous view of the three-domed church. This is a must for Santorini Instagram Spots post. You can get a closer look, but you‚Äôll be passing the private property.
sources.shortName: 10 Santorini Instagram Spots You Can‚Äôt Miss

places.name: Blue Domed Church Santorini

reviews.text: I went on a tour of the blue dome churches of Oia Santorini, Greece.  The buildings of Santorini are painted white with blue dome churches. All structures are set into the cliffs overlooking the Aegean Sea. And, of course, I was inspired to do as many tourists do, that is to take a flying dress photoshoot!  The island is breathtakingly beautiful and Instagram worthy!

The famous blue domes of Oia are lovely, but I still feel they are a bit overrated. There are other blue domes like the one in Paros or red domes, like the ones at Mykonos that are equally beautiful. The advantage of Oia is that we have 3 blue domes close to each other, and that makes a great backdrop :)

If you are not staying at Oia, be prepared to park the car at the entrance of Oia and walk to the Blue Domes. It's a decent walk with some elevation.

Be prepared for ques at all famous spots for selfies. Luckily, I was staying some 20 meters from the domes, so I had the luxury to go early in the morning and late at night and take as many pics as I wanted without being in line :D
I visited a few years ago. The white buildings, blue ocean, and blue sky are very beautiful!

places.generalDescription: Sunset Ammoudi by Paraskevas is a charming hidden spot in Oia, Santorini, nestled at the base of the Caldera cliffs. It's renowned for its breathtaking sunset views over the Aegean Sea, making it a perfect location for capturing stunning photographs. The tiny fishing port offers a variety of dining options with picturesque backdrops, including the popular Thalami known for its delectable pasta and lobster dishes.

sources.snippet: Sunset Ammoudi is a hidden gem located in the village of Oia on the island of Santorini. This bay, situated at the base of the Caldera cliffs, is aptly named for its suitability as a sunset viewing spot. From this vantage point, you can enjoy stunning views over the Aegean Sea, making it an ideal location for capturing beautiful photographs when visiting Oia, Santorini.
sources.shortName: 6 Best Photo Spots in Oia - Most IG Spot

places.name: Sunset Ammoudi by Paraskevas

reviews.text: The most beautiful dinner and so romantic. Our server was so amazing and we ordered everything he recommended. The food was divine and we absolutely loved the whole vibe. It gets a bit windy at night, so I recommend bringing an extra layer, but they had blankets for those who forgot to bring an extra cover-up! 10 out of 10!

everything tasted delicious, octopus leg was a little bit firm. but service was great, we came without reservation and sat right by the sea. we ordered fish, orzo past with fish, grilled squid and octopus. vibe is amazing, especially for sunset. the place is pricy.

Great place with very good food. Their sundried octopus is a must order. Lobster pasta is a signature dish - definitely delicious but one could argue it is great but nothing shouts outstanding per se. Still a good choice to order though. Oysters are super fresh. Yes a bit touristy but then what do you expect for such a picturesque place? The views are stunning and make sure you go catch the sunset.

places.generalDescription: Ammoudi Bay, also known as the old port of Oia, is a charming and tiny port located just a short distance from the center of Oia. Accessible by foot, donkey ride, or car, this picturesque bay offers crystal-clear waters and a romantic sunset view. Visitors can enjoy traditional taverns serving fresh seafood right by the sea. For adventure seekers, there's a path leading down to the water with sailing excursions departing from there.

sources.snippet: Our 5th Santorini Instagram photo spot is Ammoudi Bay nestled at the base of the cliffs just below Oia. To get here you can take a 20-minute walk down the Oia Steps, but remember you‚Äôll need to walk back up, all 290 of them!. Garth was a bit sad to see donkeys being used to carry tourists, it must be torture for them in the heat.
sources.shortName: 10 Santorini Instagram Spots - The Best Photo Locations

sources.snippet: Ammoudi Bay is such a beautiful spot and its how I first fell in love with Greece. I saved this spot for last because not only is it my favorite spot, but it also isn‚Äôt in the main area of Oia. To get to Ammoudi Bay, you can either take a car, ride some donkeys, or walk down about 300-400 steps.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Photo Spots in Santorini

sources.snippet: To reach Ammoudi Bay you can either drive all the way around Oia, or walk a beautiful 30min long path. There are few restaurants here which serve the best seafood on the island. The vibe of this spot in truly unique and you should not miss it while in Santorini.
sources.shortName: Voyage in Style

sources.snippet: Most lists state that the #1 best things to do in Oia, and even the #1 best thing to do in Santorini, is to watch the sunset over Ammoudi Bay.
sources.shortName: 10 best things to do in Oia (Santorini)

places.name: Ammoudi Bay

reviews.text:
Took us about 15 minutes to walk down but much longer to walk up because the steps are huge. There's also donkey poop all around so you might not want to wear your white shoes or new shoes here..

Nevertheless, the view at the bay was great and i still think it's worth the trip down from top of oia.

Was roughly a 10minute walk from the top of Oia, there is seats along the way down to help rest if needed. Once at the bottom you will see restaurants, if you continue going left the path continues and you will be able to find a little cove of crystal clear water.

A quaint port with some lovely restaurants and spectacular views. Access via the road is easier than the steps but not as pretty.

The walk up is gruelling  but you can get a donkey! Don't make my mistake and wear flip flops! Trainers or walking shoes will make the walk much easier.

sources.snippet: The blue domes are so iconic in Greece and I love how close-up you can get on this street. Zoe Aegeas Traditional Houses are located on this street, so you can find it on a google map there. The sun also lights up this spot in the morning beautifully!
sources.shortName: 10 Santorini Instagram Spots You Can‚Äôt Miss
Voyage in Style

reviews.text: It was a dream to wake up and see the city on top of the mountains! We had to take the gondolas up and once you're there everything seams so beautiful! Lots of shops! And our 25 min ride to santorini offered beautiful sceneries. Once in Santorini it's just another level of beauty. Definitely a beautiful experience.

The little town of Oia in Santorini is one of the magical places of the Greek Isles. It is a must for anyone who loves amazing views and especially beautiful sunsets! üåÖ  I was enchanted by its architecture and its bluish tones plus its beautiful flowers. However you decide to get here, it is worth the trip so make it part of your bucket list!
Stunning view - everything you expected. But it's a beautiful town so make sure to explore as there is a picture round every turn.

sources.snippet: Luckily, the place we were staying at had direct access to this location. However, this area is private but everyone still lines up and gets photos anyways. Tip: This is a private area.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Photo Spots in Santorini

reviews.text: Excellent views, but lots of people here. That did not stop us from taking lots of breathtaking pictures of this beautiful place.
The view is amazing but very crowded. Plan to queue up for at least 15 min to get a picture. It's a good vantage point to capture the scenic 3 blue domes in Oia, Santorini

Pretty domes but overrated. Way too crowded and hard to find a good spot to see the domes. Thought there would be more blue domes from all the photos you see. Best option is to grab a table on a balcony and enjoy a drink with the view, albeit a pricy one.

places.generalDescription: The Church Mother of Lord Theoskepasti, a small and picturesque Orthodox church, is situated on the edge of the Imerovigli cliff. It boasts stunning views of the sea caldera and features a beautiful blue dome with a bell tower, surrounded by a charming garden. Accessible via a path from Imerovigli to Skaros rock, this remote chapel offers an awe-inspiring experience as it stands alone against the horizon.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a pretty church with amazing views, the Mother of Lord Theoskepasti Holy Orthodox Church will not disappoint!. This small church is located on the edge of the Imerovigli cliff and it offers breathtaking views of the sea caldera. It has a beautiful blue dome with a bell tower and it‚Äôs surrounded by a small garden.
sources.shortName: Top 29 Best Santorini Instagram Spots You Can't Miss

sources.snippet: Completely hidden by the rock, you‚Äôll find Theoskepasti Church on the other side. This is also a gorgeous spot for sunset Santorini photography. From this side of the rock (or from the top), you can see the entire caldera without any obstructions.
sources.shortName: Santorini Photography: 21+ Best Santorini Photo Spots + Map

places.name: Holy Church of Panagia Theoskepasti

reviews.text: Just skip the Fira or any other Santorini's viewpoints and hike here for sunset, it's amazing and here's a plenty of space. Nice perk is to bell in 3 church bells. There are 2 roads to the church: main one after historical cards goes via top of the cliff and left before historical cards has less up and downs, just straight road to the church. Walk from the city requires a little physical fitness, majority of the road has steps and some rocks.
Hidden behind Skaros Rock is a beautiful almost surprising church. The path is a little dangerous, but the view makes the place worth a visit as long as you are careful.

The most amazing sunset I have ever seen. It is located really close to Imerovigli. Only 15-20min walk. The trail is not difficult at all. It is a simple walk with a few steps. The sunset here is a must.

places.generalDescription: The Windmill of Oia in Greece is a picturesque spot situated on a breezy hill, offering stunning views and the perfect backdrop for photography. This milk-white windmill with a thatched roof was originally used to produce flour for Greek staples. It's an iconic location in Oia and is best visited during sunset for optimal lighting and fewer crowds.

sources.snippet: When walking on the main street of Oia (from east to west), turn left between the little church and the jewellery store called Alexandros. Just follow the tiny alley and you will bump right into the bells of Oia.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful photo locations in Santorini

places.name: Windmill of Oia

reviews.text:
Amazing! This is a must place to see.
You can make a lot of nice photos.

Uniqueness : 8/10
Experience: 8/10
Value: NA

Quiet. Calm. Windy. Santorini blue sky. Some cool boutique hotels nearby. Great escape from crowds. Aegean Sea.

Best Sunset!
Off-season is best time in oia, feels like private island just for you!
